"Progress bar" widget
The "Progress bar" widget
is a tool for displaying the progress of a process.
Examples of a customized widget:
Configuring the widget
The widget is added in the mode of editing the
visual of an instance
of an object type. When switching to the "Widgets" tab on the "Elements" panel, it is necessary to drag-and-drop the "Progress bar" widget from the "Charts and Graphs" section to the workspace of the profile.
After clicking the
button, a modal window for configuring the widget will open.
Settings
In the modal window that opens, the widget is configured as follows:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the setting name.
By default, the "Progress bar 1" name is used, when adding a second and subsequent progress bar, the number increases by 1
.
Process progress source
Determining the source for which the percentage of process execution will be transmitted.
The selection is made from previously created instances of the "Process progress source" [SYS_PROCESS_PROGRESS] type using a drop-down list.
Adding a new process progress source is carried out in a modal window, which will be available after clicking on the kebab menu on the right side of the field and selecting the "Add" option in the context menu. To add a new source, specify its name and save the object (see the figure after the table).
There is no need to manually fill in the "Process progress by object" type registry embedded in the source profile
, instances are created automatically in the process of progress change (see the figure after the table).
View
Determining the type of process progress display.
Possible options:
classic;
battery;
circular;
semicircular.
The default value is "Classic"
.
Style
Determining the
formatting style
.
The selection is made from the
formatting styles
using a drop-down list.
Adding a new style is done by clicking on the kebab menu on the right side of the field and selecting the "Add" option in the context menu. In this case, the background color determines the color of the progress fill, and the font properties are applied to the displayed percentage of progress.
If the style does not specify a font size, it is set to 16 px when the "Classic" progress bar type is selected, and 20 px for all other types.
By default, the "Success Style" is used
.
Display percent
Displaying the completed progress of the process as a percentage. The option is available when the switch is in the active position.
By default, the switch is inactive.
To further configure the progress bar, an
algorithm
of the object will be required, in the code of which the progress value is set using the SetProgress function. When calling the function, the user must specify two parameters:
the data source specified when configuring the Progress Bar widget in the Process Progress Source field;
the progress value is a numeric value from 0 to 100, determined by a number, or a variable/attribute of a numeric type.
The process progress is changed by means of the "Progress bar" widget in the object instance profile after the algorithm execution for this object is started.
In this case, changes in the progress of the process are recorded in the register of the "Process progress by object" type, embedded in the object profile of the progress bar source by automatically creating instances containing the following data:
name of the instance;
link to source of the progress bar;
an instance of the object that was used to run the algorithm for changing the progress of the process;
the percentage of process completion.
Use example
It is necessary to monitor the progress of calculating the classification of credit claims.
To do this:
1. Add the "Progress bar" widget to the object profile.
2. In the widget settings:
enter the name;
use the drop-down list to specify the type of "Circle" progress bar;
after clicking on the kebab menu, add the process progress source by entering the name and saving the source profile;
switch the "Display percent" switch to the active position.
3. Add the SetProgress function to the algorithm for calculating the classification of credit claims, specify the created source process progress as the first parameter, and determine the percentage of process completion as the second parameter. The algorithm will take the following form:
4. After the algorithm execution for the object with the "Progress bar" widget, the calculation progress will be displayed in the object profile.
